gov.nasa.larcfm.Util

Class TurnGeneration

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.larcfm.Util.TurnGeneration

  • public final class TurnGeneration
extends java.lang.Object
    TurnGeneration provides methods to generate the beginning, middle, and end of turn (BOTs, MOTs, and EOTs). This class finds solutions that are based on spherical trigonometry without having to use projections (the original versions of these methods in TrajGen used Euclidean projections).

    • Method Detail

      • turnGenerator

        public static Triple<NavPoint,NavPoint,NavPoint> turnGenerator(NavPoint np1,
                                                               NavPoint np2,
                                                               NavPoint np3,
                                                               double radius)
        Find the beginning, middle, and end points of a turn using three points and the given radius. It is assumed that the three points are in ordered such that the second point is the vertex of the turn.

        It is expected that these properties hold:

        • The BOT/EOT velocity is track angle of the velocity at the BOT/EOT point.
        • The ground speed and vertical speed are set by the speed from np1 to np2 for BOT, and np2 to np3 for EOT.
        • The time of the MOT is the same as the time for np2
        • The times of the BOT and EOT points are set as if the turn is traversed at a ground speed equal to the ground speed from np1 to np2.
        • The altitude of the MOT point is set to np2's altitude
        • The altitude of BOT is set as if there is a constant vertical speed from np1 to np2
        • The altitude of EOT is set as if there is a constant vertical speed from np2 to np3
        Parameters:
        np1 - point 1
        np2 - point 2 (the vertex, or turn point)
        np3 - point 3
        radius - the turn radius (always positive)
        Returns:
        The beginning, middle, and ending turn points (ie, BOT, MOT, EOT) NOTE: TrajGen is currently using THIS ONE.

      • turnGenerator

        public static Tuple5<Position,Position,Position,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> turnGenerator(Position p1,
                                                                                                  Position p2,
                                                                                                  Position p3,
                                                                                                  double radius)
        Find the beginning, middle, and end points of a turn using three points and the given radius. The three points are in ordered such that the second point is the vertex of the turn. The BOT is along the line from p1 to p2, the EOT is along the line from p2 to p3, the MOT is in middle of the turn.

        Parameters:
        p1 - point 1
        p2 - point 2 (the vertex, or turn point)
        p3 - point 3
        radius - the turn radius (always positive)
        Returns:
        The beginning, middle, and ending turn points (ie, BOT, MOT, EOT), direction of turn (-1 for left, 1 for right), arc distance along turn from right to left.

      • turnGeneratorEucl

        public static Tuple5<Vect2,Vect2,Vect2,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> turnGeneratorEucl(Vect2 pt1,
                                                                                             Vect2 pt2,
                                                                                             Vect2 pt3,
                                                                                             double radius)
        Return the BOT and EOT trajectory change points for a turn (Horizontal Components Only)
        Parameters:
        np1 - Start point of the leg before the turn
        np2 - Vertex of the turn
        np3 - End point of the leg after the turn
        radius - Radius of the turn (always positive)
        Returns:
        BOT,MOT,EOT positions, direction, and arclength from BOT to EOT

      • turnGeneratorProjected

        public static Triple<NavPoint,NavPoint,NavPoint> turnGeneratorProjected(NavPoint np1,
                                                                        NavPoint np2,
                                                                        NavPoint np3,
                                                                        double R)
        Return the BOT, MOT, and EOT TCPs for a turn. NOTE. MOT.alt = np.alt() velocity in metadata is set correctly for BOT, with track values modified to match the MOT and EOT points
        Parameters:
        np1 - Start point of the leg before the turn
        np2 - Vertex of the turn
        np3 - End point of the leg after the turn
        R - Radius of the turn
        Returns:
        BOT,MOT,EOT triple.

      • turnGeneratorLLA

        public static Tuple5<LatLonAlt,LatLonAlt,LatLonAlt,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> turnGeneratorLLA(LatLonAlt p2,
                                                                                                        double trkIn,
                                                                                                        double trkOut,
                                                                                                        double radius)
        Return the BOT and EOT trajectory change points for a turn (Horizontal Components Only, altitudes are not accurately computed)
        Parameters:
        p2 - the turn point
        trkIn - the "track in" to the turn point
        trkOut - the "track out" of the turn point
        radius - radius of the turn
        Returns:
        returns BOT, MOT, EOT, direction, and arc distance from BOT to EOT along the curve

      • turnGeneratorLLA

        public static Tuple5<LatLonAlt,LatLonAlt,LatLonAlt,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> turnGeneratorLLA(LatLonAlt p1,

                                                                                                        LatLonAlt p3,
                                                                                                        double radius)
        Return the BOT and EOT trajectory change points for a turn (Horizontal Components Only, altitudes are set to p1's altitude)
        Parameters:
        p1 - first point
        p2 - second point (the turn point)
        p3 - third point
        radius - radius of turn
        Returns:
        returns BOT, MOT, EOT, direction, and arc distance from BOT to EOT along the curve
